I now made arrangements for my journey
but one feeling haunted me which
filled me with fear and agitation.
During my absence I should leave my
friends unconscious of the existence
of their enemy, and unprotected from
his attacks, exasperated as he
might be by my departure. But he
had promised to follow me wherever
I might go and would he not accom
pany me to England? This imagination was
dreadful in itself but soothing in
as much as ^it supposed the safety of my friends
. I was agonized with
the idea of a possibility that the reverse
of this might happen. But
